intro: Marila dissitiflora, commonly known as the clustered marila, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of ovate to lanceolate leaves with a rough texture.
